title: At Long Last, It's The Peepers Big Night
teaser: Before frogs can start singing in the spring, a massive migration of millions of amphibians has to take place first.
contentencoded:
After a long and frigid winter, the sound of peepers is a welcome sound for New Englanders. But before frogs can start singing in the spring, a massive migration has to take place first. It all happens on a handful of nights with a cast of millions of amphibians. From the Here & Now Contributors Network, Sam Evans-Brown of New Hampshire Public Radio reports.

  • Read more on this story via NHPR
  • See photos of a spotted salamander and a salamander tunnel

Reporter

  • Sam Evans-Brown, environment and education reporter for New Hampshire Public Radio. He tweets @SamEB_NHPR.
